sentence.Network_en: He lived on an invalidity pension which came as a weekly giro.
sentence.Network_cn: 他靠每周领取的作为病残养老金的直接转账救济支票过日子。

sentence.Network_en: Politicians want a lap-dog press which will uncritically report their propaganda.
sentence.Network_cn: 政客们想要的是不问是非、甘为他们搞宣传的哈巴狗一样的新闻媒体。

sentence.Network_en: We were in the same college, which was male-only at that time.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们那时在同一所学院，当时只招男生。

jx.jx_en_mean: used when two or more people or things are difficult to distinguish from each other
jx.jx_cn_mean: 哪一个是哪一个；什么是什么

lj.lj_ly: there is no confusion as to which is which.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English hwilc, from the Germanic bases of who and alike

encyclopedia.content: 品牌介绍： WHICH自诞生以来，坚持以其独特的构思，向大众传递着时尚的知性和雅致，每一件商品均融合欧洲时尚的走向，加入日本设计师对色彩的大胆运用，以及对独特面料、完美细节的坚持下，以展现WHICH品牌特有的风格，让充满活力的年轻女性搭配后更散发出个人独有专属动人的魅力！就是哪一个“WHICH”！WHICH品牌，不仅是高级品质的直接体现，更是深厚文化的长期沉淀。WHICH在深刻领悟品牌文化的基础上，更懂得高效团队在品牌发

entry.def: You use which in questions when there are two or more possible answers or alternatives.

example.ex: Which do they want me to do? declare war or surrender?...
example.tran: 他们想让我做什么,宣战还是投降？

example.ex: Which are the ones you really like?...
example.tran: 哪些是你们真正喜欢的？

entry.tran: (用于指明在两个或多个答案或选项中所作出的选择)哪个，哪些
entry.def: You use which to refer to a choice between two or more possible answers or alternatives.

example.ex: I wanted to know which school it was you went to...
example.tran: 我想知道你上的是哪所学校。

example.ex: I can't remember which teachers I had...
example.tran: 我记不清哪些老师教过我。

entry.tran: (用于关系从句句首，具体说明所谈论的事物或提供关于它的更多信息)
entry.def: You use which at the beginning of a relative clause when specifying the thing that you are talking about or when giving more information about it.

example.ex: Soldiers opened fire on a car which failed to stop at an army checkpoint...
example.tran: 士兵向那辆拒绝在军事检查站停车检查的汽车开了火。

example.ex: He's based in Banja Luka, which is the largest city in northern Bosnia...
example.tran: 他驻扎在波斯尼亚北部的最大城市巴尼亚卢卡。

entry.tran: (用来回指前面句子表达的观点或状况)这，那
entry.def: You use which to refer back to an idea or situation expressed in a previous sentence or sentences, especially when you want to give your opinion about it.

example.ex: They ran out of drink. Which actually didn't bother me because I wasn't drinking...
example.tran: 他们把酒喝完了。但实际上这对我来说无所谓，因为我不喝酒。

example.ex: Since we started in September we have raised fifty thousand pounds, which is pretty good going...
example.tran: 我们自从9月份开始以来，已经募集到5万英镑，进展相当顺利。

entry.tran: 哪个是哪个(用于表示无法区分)
entry.def: If you cannot tell the difference between two things, you can say that you do not know which is which .

example.ex: They all look so alike to me that I'm never sure which is which...
example.tran: 对我来说他们看起来全都非常相似，我永远搞不清哪个是哪个。

example.ex: It's essential to know which is which as treatments will be quite different.
example.tran: 由于治疗的方法将会全然不同，因此弄清楚哪个是哪个很重要。

example.en: Says which?I don't believe what I heard.
example.zh: 你说什么?我才不信你的话呢。

sentences.en: That is the house which I built.
I can't decide which to choose.
sentences.cn: 我无法决定要选哪一个。

sentences.en: Let me know which train you'll be arriving on.
sentences.cn: 告诉我你要坐哪一趟车来。

jushi.english: Mary and Susan are twins and I can't tell which is which.
jushi.chinese: 玛丽和苏珊是孪生姐妹,我分不出来谁是谁。

jushi.english: He said he had lost his bicycle,which〔and that〕 was untrue.
jushi.chinese: 他说他的自行车丢了,那不是真的。

jushi.english: That is the house which I built.
